tags.name: Directions API
tags.description: The Directions API is a service that provides directions between two addresses.

post.summary: Provides routable path between two or more points
post.description: Provides routable path between two or more points. Accepts coordinates in lat,long format.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Destination coordinates in the format lat,lng e.g:  12.993103152916301,77.54332622119354

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Origin coordinates in the format lat,lng e.g:  12.972006793201695,77.5800850011884

parameters.name: waypoints
parameters.description: Waypoints joined by separator (currently '|'). supported as lat,lng pairs - 12.938399,77.632873|12.938041,77.628285

parameters.name: alternatives
parameters.description: True if multiple routes are needed between source and destination

parameters.name: steps
parameters.description: True if steps are needed between source and destination

parameters.name: overview
parameters.description: Overview geometry either full, simplified or false according to highest zoom level it could be display on, or not at all

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language in which the response is expected. At the moment following languages are supported - kn (Kannada), en (English) and hi (Hindi)

parameters.name: traffic_metadata
parameters.description: If this field is true, traffic metadata would be sent in the  response which will contain type of congestion. (travel_advisory data  will only come in response if overview is passed as "full")

500.description: No serviceable boundary found for GeoPoints

get.summary: Provides Autocomplete suggestions for a given substring
get.description: Provides Autocomplete suggestions for a given substring satisfying the given criteria

parameters.name: input
parameters.description: The text string on which to search. The Place Autocomplete service will return candidate matches based on this string and order results based on their perceived relevance

parameters.name: location
parameters.description:
Location parameter helps in fetching more location specific results. This parameter must be specified as *latitude,longitude*.\
**Note** : If the location parameter is not specified, only name  match is given priority.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Defines the distance (in meters) within which to return place results. This is obeyed when the param strictbounds is set to true

parameters.name: strictbounds
parameters.description: Returns only those places that are strictly within the radius defined by location and radius. This is a restriction, rather than a bias, meaning that results outside this radius will not be returned even if they match the user input

200.description: Successful response. Please note there are multiple responses possible based on the scenario. One possibility is autocomplete results are  returned, which is outlined in example and scehma. Other possibility is  zero results which is outlined under schema

error_message.example: Invalid param 'input': input length, must be >0

request_id.description: X-Request-Id if provided in the request else a auto-generated value is assigned

get.description: Returns the geocoded address based on the provided parameters

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address to be geocoded. It cannot be empty.

parameters.name: bounds
parameters.description:
Pipe ("|") separated lat,lng pairs of two corner points of a bounding box. 
Example: 12.905004590071838,77.60793990913315|12.90221233024448,77.60555810753645

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language in which to return the results. Currently only accepts English.

geocodingResults.formatted_address: Mumbai, Mumbai Suburban, Mumbai Suburban District, Maharashtra, India
geocodingResults.name: Mumbai

get.summary: Provides information of a place based on the location provided
get.description: Provides information of a place based on the location provided satisfying the given criteria

parameters.name: latlng
parameters.description: The coordinates of which you want to do the reverse geocoding to get the address

200.description: Successful response. Please note there are multiple responses possible  based on the scenario. One possibility is autocomplete results are returned,  which is outlined in example and scehma. Other possibility is zero results  which is outlined under schema

request_id.description: X-Request-Id if provided in the request else a auto-generated value is assigned
X-Request-Id if provided in the request else a auto-generated value is assigned

parameters.name: datasetName
parameters.description: Name of the dataset

200.description: This API provides array of objects for data tilejsons, List of all the data sets that are available for the tiling service

get.description: Returns the PBF file for data

parameters.name: datasetName
parameters.description: Name of the dataset

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: Mercator tiles's zoom level

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Specifies the tile's column {x}, as described in the Slippy Map Tilenames specification.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Specifies the tile's row {y}, as described in the Slippy Map Tilenames specification.

get.description:
`{style-name}-lite`: The Lite version of the map style will only include a selection of features, with a primary focus on Navigation platforms. \
`{style-name}-standard`: The Standard version will have a more granular level of information than lite which can be used for viewing purposes and across all platforms such as mobility, portals, and websites. \
`{style-name}-full`: Full version will include all the available data of the map features which might not be used now but users will have the option to customize according to their preference. Datasets such as glaciers, and house numbers. (Currently, the full version is WIP and is a copy of the standard) \
\
*Ex. For default light, `default-light-lite`, `default-light-standard` & `default-light-full` will be the style names*

200.description: This API provides array of objects for all styles

get.description: Get detail of a style, This is useful for software developers who want to programmatically read these resources. It isn't necessary for you to read or understand this reference to design or use Mapbox/Maplibre maps. You will need to be familiar with the MapLibre Style Specification to use the Styles API. The Maplibre Style Specification defines the structure of map styles and is the open standard that helps maplibre communicate with APIs and produce maps that are compatible with Maplibre libraries.

parameters.name: styleName
parameters.description: Name of the style

200.description: This API provides array of objects for all styles, This is the endpoint that the clients (mapbox/leaflet/deck gl/maplibre) will consume for the styled layers.

get.description: While glyph ranges are usually not of interest unless you're building a map renderer, this is the endpoint you can use to access them. Font glyph ranges are protocol buffer-encoded signed distance fields. They can be used to show fonts at a variety of scales and rotations. One glyph is used at all scales.

parameters.name: fontstack
parameters.description: Name of the Font Stack

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Start tile number

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: End tile number

GetArrayOfStyleTilejsons.description: Get list of all style's tilejson

GetArrayOfDataTilejsons.description: Get list of all data tilejson

example.description: Tile config based on OpenMapTiles schema

x_correlation_id.description: A UUIDv4 unique over a series of requests and responses, identifying a transaction
